lexUnit.name: warm.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause an entity to become higher in termperature by subjecting it to a heat source

sentence.text: As the sun warms their walls , the air inside becomes hotter than that in the centre of the nest .

He tried to warm them with his hands .
Donna warmed her hands round her tea and glanced at her watch again .
The three of the family warmed their hands .
The cooking had to be done on an open fire and , when we wanted a bath , we warmed the water in a pan and poured it into a tin bath in front of the fire .

But I enjoy knowing that the first sun in the world will warm you here in these islands .

It was formed by a number of volcanic eruptions , the last of which was around the 18th century BC , and its hot-headed volcanic formations warm the local waters to delicious bathing temperatures .
The volcanic nature of the Aeolian islands benefits the visitor by warming the local waters to ideal bathing temperatures and the clear blue waters are superb for underwater swimming .
He tried to warm her with his body but he was so cold himself he did n't know if it would work .

She was warming her feet at the fire and putting her hair up , as efficiently as a musician putting away his instrument when a concert has been cancelled .

Use cloches to warm the ground for sowing salads .
` Sit down , Phoebe , I 'll warm some more milk for you . "
Do n't warm wine by placing it next to a radiator or open fire , as this will cause it to taste coarse .
If you want to warm rooms in very cold temperatures set the heating to come on earlier rather than turning it up higher .
The anomalous heat is thought to be due to solar energy , which penetrates the surface ice in spring and warms the depths .

He grunted with annoyance and sat down in the sparse grass with his back to the worn stone and let the meagre sun warm him .

Corbett gulped the rich , red wine , relishing the way it warmed his stomach .

I sat absorbed in my button-making , warmed by the winter sun and content to let the quiet conversation move around me .
Frozen solid in winter , they warm quickly in spring sunshine and may reach temperatures of 1516C by high summer , but are the first to slow down and freeze in autumn .
